curated_text: Symbol: ADBE. Year: 2025. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: Figma, Adobe, the Securities Action, Shah, the U.S., District Court, the “Shah Action, Gervat, Court, Gervat Actions, the “Consolidated Derivative Action, California Superior Court, the Consolidated Derivative Action, The Derivative Actions, the Securities 21 Table of Contents ADOBE INC., Board of Directors, the Securities Exchange Act, the Gervat Action, Adobe’s, the Shah Action, the Derivative Actions, Contents ADOBE INC., Issuance Date Due Date Effective Interest Rate, SOFR OIS, the “Revolving Credit Agreement, The Revolving Credit Agreement, the Revolving Credit Agreement, Commercial Paper Program, ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, SEC, BUSINESS OVERVIEW Adobe, APAC, Digital Media, Digital, 3D, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Express, ARR, Digital Media ARR, Digital Media Enterprise Term, Digital Experience, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Commerce, Adobe Campaign, the Adobe Experience Platform, Customer-Focused Strategy, Adobe GenStudio, • Business Professionals and Consumers, the Business Professionals and Consumers, Adobe Firefly, the Creative and Marketing Professionals, Photoshop, Lightroom. Context excerpt: competition from Figma and the adequacy of Adobe’s existing offerings to counter harms Adobe may have faced due to Figma’s growing market position were materially false and misleading. The Securities Action seeks unspecified compensatory damages, attorneys’ fees and costs, and extraordinary equitable and/or injunctive relief. We filed a motion to dismiss the Securities Action, which was fully briefed as of May 23, 2024. On November 16, 2023, a shareholder derivative action captioned Shah v. Narayen et al, Case No. 1:23-cv-01315, was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware (the “Shah Action”), purportedly on behalf of Adobe. On January 3, 2024, a second shareholder derivative action captioned Gervat v. Narayen et al, Case No. 1:24-cv-00006, was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware (the “Gervat Action”), purportedly on behalf of Adobe. On January 24, 2024, the Court consolidated the Shah and Gervat Actions (together, the “Consolidated Deriva
